name: VeracodeCommunityScaAdoExtension
friendlyName: Veracode Community SCA Azure DevOps Extension
description: Veracode Community SCA Azure DevOps Extension
author: Joe Gatt

inputs.name: scanType
inputs.label: Scan type.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of scan: artifact, docker image or a url of a git repo.

inputs.name: scanTarget
inputs.label: Target to scan.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target to scan: either a soure directory containing artifacts, a docker image, or a url of a git repo.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application name (used for labeling test results).
inputs.helpMarkDown: Application name (used for labeling test results). If omitted, test results will be labeled with the project name.

inputs.name: minCVSS
inputs.label: Minimum CVSS score to report on (Default is 5).
inputs.helpMarkDown: Minimum CVSS score to report on. Please note: full results are still sent to the Veracode cloud.

inputs.name: recursiveScan
inputs.label: Perform a recursive scan on the target.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Perform a recursive scan on the target. Enabling this can help SCA correctly identify the target application stack.

inputs.name: failBuild
inputs.label: Fail the build or release if vulnerabilities are identified.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build or release if vulnerabilities are identified. The default of false will report failed tests in the pipeline.

inputs.name: testAgent
inputs.label: Test agent capabilities for running Veracode SCA Agent based scans.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable this to output agent capabilites to stdout if you are having issues setting up your scan environment.
